00029 /* a problem is an item on the solver's problem list. It can either be >0, in that
00030  * case it is a update/infarch/dup rule, or it can be <0, which makes it refer to a job
00031  * consisting of multiple job rules.
00032  */
00033 
00034 void
00035 solver_disableproblem(Solver *solv, Id v)
00036 {
00037   Rule *r;
00038   int i;
00039   Id *jp;
00040 
00041   if (v > 0)
00042     {
00043       if (v >= solv->infarchrules && v < solv->infarchrules_end)
00044         {
00045           Pool *pool = solv->pool;
00046           Id name = pool->solvables[-solv->rules[v].p].name;
00047           while (v > solv->infarchrules && pool->solvables[-solv->rules[v - 1].p].name == name)
00048             v--;
00049           for (; v < solv->infarchrules_end && pool->solvables[-solv->rules[v].p].name == name; v++)
00050             solver_disablerule(solv, solv->rules + v);
00051           return;
00052         }
00053       if (v >= solv->duprules && v < solv->duprules_end)
00054         {
00055           Pool *pool = solv->pool;
00056           Id name = pool->solvables[-solv->rules[v].p].name;
00057           while (v > solv->duprules && pool->solvables[-solv->rules[v - 1].p].name == name)
00058             v--;
00059           for (; v < solv->duprules_end && pool->solvables[-solv->rules[v].p].name == name; v++)
00060             solver_disablerule(solv, solv->rules + v);
00061           return;
00062         }
00063       solver_disablerule(solv, solv->rules + v);
00064 #if 0
00065       /* XXX: doesn't work */
00066       if (v >= solv->updaterules && v < solv->updaterules_end)
00067         {
00068           /* enable feature rule if we disabled the update rule */
00069           r = solv->rules + (v - solv->updaterules + solv->featurerules);
00070           if (r->p)
00071             solver_enablerule(solv, r);
00072         }
00073 #endif
00074       return;
00075     }
00076   v = -(v + 1);
00077   jp = solv->ruletojob.elements;
00078   for (i = solv->jobrules, r = solv->rules + i; i < solv->jobrules_end; i++, r++, jp++)
00079     if (*jp == v)
00080       solver_disablerule(solv, r);
00081 }
00082 
00083 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------
00084  * enableproblem
00085  */
00086 
00087 void
00088 solver_enableproblem(Solver *solv, Id v)
00089 {
00090   Rule *r;
00091   int i;
00092   Id *jp;
00093 
00094   if (v > 0)
00095     {
00096       if (v >= solv->infarchrules && v < solv->infarchrules_end)
00097         {
00098           Pool *pool = solv->pool;
00099           Id name = pool->solvables[-solv->rules[v].p].name;
00100           while (v > solv->infarchrules && pool->solvables[-solv->rules[v - 1].p].name == name)
00101             v--;
00102           for (; v < solv->infarchrules_end && pool->solvables[-solv->rules[v].p].name == name; v++)
00103             solver_enablerule(solv, solv->rules + v);
00104           return;
00105         }
00106       if (v >= solv->duprules && v < solv->duprules_end)
00107         {
00108           Pool *pool = solv->pool;
00109           Id name = pool->solvables[-solv->rules[v].p].name;
00110           while (v > solv->duprules && pool->solvables[-solv->rules[v - 1].p].name == name)
00111             v--;
00112           for (; v < solv->duprules_end && pool->solvables[-solv->rules[v].p].name == name; v++)
00113             solver_enablerule(solv, solv->rules + v);
00114           return;
00115         }
00116       if (v >= solv->featurerules && v < solv->featurerules_end)
00117         {
00118           /* do not enable feature rule if update rule is enabled */
00119           r = solv->rules + (v - solv->featurerules + solv->updaterules);
00120           if (r->d >= 0)
00121             return;
00122         }
00123       solver_enablerule(solv, solv->rules + v);
00124       if (v >= solv->updaterules && v < solv->updaterules_end)
00125         {
00126           /* disable feature rule when enabling update rule */
00127           r = solv->rules + (v - solv->updaterules + solv->featurerules);
00128           if (r->p)
00129             solver_disablerule(solv, r);
00130         }
00131       return;
00132     }
00133   v = -(v + 1);
00134   jp = solv->ruletojob.elements;
00135   for (i = solv->jobrules, r = solv->rules + i; i < solv->jobrules_end; i++, r++, jp++)
00136     if (*jp == v)
00137       solver_enablerule(solv, r);
00138 }

00141 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------
00142  * enable weak rules
00143  * 
00144  * Reenable all disabled weak rules (marked in weakrulemap)
00145  * 
00146  */
00147 
00148 static void
00149 enableweakrules(Solver *solv)
00150 {
00151   int i;
00152   Rule *r;
00153 
00154   for (i = 1, r = solv->rules + i; i < solv->learntrules; i++, r++)
00155     {
00156       if (r->d >= 0) /* already enabled? */
00157         continue;
00158       if (!MAPTST(&solv->weakrulemap, i))
00159         continue;
00160       solver_enablerule(solv, r);
00161     }
00162 }
00163 
00164 
00165 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------
00166  * 
00167  * refine_suggestion
00168  * 
00169  * at this point, all rules that led to conflicts are disabled.
00170  * we re-enable all rules of a problem set but rule "sug", then
00171  * continue to disable more rules until there as again a solution.
00172  */
00173 
00174 /* FIXME: think about conflicting assertions */
00175 
00176 static void
00177 refine_suggestion(Solver *solv, Id *problem, Id sug, Queue *refined, int essentialok)
00178 {
00179   Pool *pool = solv->pool;
00180   int i, j;
00181   Id v;
00182   Queue disabled;
00183   int disabledcnt;
00184 
00185   IF_POOLDEBUG (SAT_DEBUG_SOLUTIONS)
00186     {
00187       POOL_DEBUG(SAT_DEBUG_SOLUTIONS, "refine_suggestion start\n");
00188       for (i = 0; problem[i]; i++)
00189         {
00190           if (problem[i] == sug)
00191             POOL_DEBUG(SAT_DEBUG_SOLUTIONS, "=> ");
00192           solver_printproblem(solv, problem[i]);
00193         }
00194     }
00195   queue_empty(refined);
00196   if (!essentialok && sug < 0 && (solv->job.elements[-sug - 1] & SOLVER_ESSENTIAL) != 0)
00197     return;
00198   queue_init(&disabled);
00199   queue_push(refined, sug);
00200 
00201   /* re-enable all problem rules with the exception of "sug"(gestion) */
00202   solver_reset(solv);
00203 
00204   for (i = 0; problem[i]; i++)
00205     if (problem[i] != sug)
00206       solver_enableproblem(solv, problem[i]);
00207 
00208   if (sug < 0)
00209     solver_reenablepolicyrules(solv, -(sug + 1));
00210   else if (sug >= solv->updaterules && sug < solv->updaterules_end)
00211     {
00212       /* enable feature rule */
00213       Rule *r = solv->rules + solv->featurerules + (sug - solv->updaterules);
00214       if (r->p)
00215         solver_enablerule(solv, r);
00216     }
00217 
00218   enableweakrules(solv);
00219 
00220   for (;;)
00221     {
00222       int njob, nfeature, nupdate;
00223       queue_empty(&solv->problems);
00224       solver_reset(solv);
00225 
00226       if (!solv->problems.count)
00227         solver_run_sat(solv, 0, 0);
00228 
00229       if (!solv->problems.count)
00230         {
00231           POOL_DEBUG(SAT_DEBUG_SOLUTIONS, "no more problems!\n");
00232           IF_POOLDEBUG (SAT_DEBUG_SCHUBI)
00233             solver_printdecisions(solv);
00234           break;                /* great, no more problems */
00235         }
00236       disabledcnt = disabled.count;
00237       /* start with 1 to skip over proof index */
00238       njob = nfeature = nupdate = 0;
00239       for (i = 1; i < solv->problems.count - 1; i++)
00240         {
00241           /* ignore solutions in refined */
00242           v = solv->problems.elements[i];
00243           if (v == 0)
00244             break;      /* end of problem reached */
00245           for (j = 0; problem[j]; j++)
00246             if (problem[j] != sug && problem[j] == v)
00247               break;
00248           if (problem[j])
00249             continue;
00250           if (v >= solv->featurerules && v < solv->featurerules_end)
00251             nfeature++;
00252           else if (v > 0)
00253             nupdate++;
00254           else
00255             {
00256               if (!essentialok && (solv->job.elements[-v -1] & SOLVER_ESSENTIAL) != 0)
00257                 continue;       /* not that one! */
00258               njob++;
00259             }
00260           queue_push(&disabled, v);
00261         }
00262       if (disabled.count == disabledcnt)
00263         {
00264           /* no solution found, this was an invalid suggestion! */
00265           POOL_DEBUG(SAT_DEBUG_SOLUTIONS, "no solution found!\n");
00266           refined->count = 0;
00267           break;
00268         }
00269       if (!njob && nupdate && nfeature)
00270         {
00271           /* got only update rules, filter out feature rules */
00272           POOL_DEBUG(SAT_DEBUG_SOLUTIONS, "throwing away feature rules\n");
00273           for (i = j = disabledcnt; i < disabled.count; i++)
00274             {
00275               v = disabled.elements[i];
00276               if (v < solv->featurerules || v >= solv->featurerules_end)
00277                 disabled.elements[j++] = v;
00278             }
00279           disabled.count = j;
00280           nfeature = 0;
00281         }
00282       if (disabled.count == disabledcnt + 1)
00283         {
00284           /* just one suggestion, add it to refined list */
00285           v = disabled.elements[disabledcnt];
00286           if (!nfeature)
00287             queue_push(refined, v);     /* do not record feature rules */
00288           solver_disableproblem(solv, v);
00289           if (v >= solv->updaterules && v < solv->updaterules_end)
00290             {
00291               Rule *r = solv->rules + (v - solv->updaterules + solv->featurerules);
00292               if (r->p)
00293                 solver_enablerule(solv, r);     /* enable corresponding feature rule */
00294             }
00295           if (v < 0)
00296             solver_reenablepolicyrules(solv, -(v + 1));
00297         }
00298       else
00299         {
00300           /* more than one solution, disable all */
00301           /* do not push anything on refine list, as we do not know which solution to choose */
00302           /* thus, the user will get another problem if he selects this solution, where he
00303            * can choose the right one */
00304           IF_POOLDEBUG (SAT_DEBUG_SOLUTIONS)
00305             {
00306               POOL_DEBUG(SAT_DEBUG_SOLUTIONS, "more than one solution found:\n");
00307               for (i = disabledcnt; i < disabled.count; i++)
00308                 solver_printproblem(solv, disabled.elements[i]);
00309             }
00310           for (i = disabledcnt; i < disabled.count; i++)
00311             {
00312               v = disabled.elements[i];
00313               solver_disableproblem(solv, v);
00314               if (v >= solv->updaterules && v < solv->updaterules_end)
00315                 {
00316                   Rule *r = solv->rules + (v - solv->updaterules + solv->featurerules);
00317                   if (r->p)
00318                     solver_enablerule(solv, r);
00319                 }
00320             }
00321         }
00322     }
00323   /* all done, get us back into the same state as before */
00324   /* enable refined rules again */
00325   for (i = 0; i < disabled.count; i++)
00326     solver_enableproblem(solv, disabled.elements[i]);
00327   queue_free(&disabled);
00328   /* reset policy rules */
00329   for (i = 0; problem[i]; i++)
00330     solver_enableproblem(solv, problem[i]);
00331   solver_disablepolicyrules(solv);
00332   /* disable problem rules again */
00333   for (i = 0; problem[i]; i++)
00334     solver_disableproblem(solv, problem[i]);
00335   POOL_DEBUG(SAT_DEBUG_SOLUTIONS, "refine_suggestion end\n");
00336 }

00338 
00339 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------
00340  * sorting helper for problems
00341  *
00342  * bring update rules before job rules
00343  * make essential job rules last
00344  */
00345 
00346 static int
00347 problems_sortcmp(const void *ap, const void *bp, void *dp)
00348 {
00349   Queue *job = dp;
00350   Id a = *(Id *)ap, b = *(Id *)bp;
00351   if (a < 0 && b > 0)
00352     return 1;
00353   if (a > 0 && b < 0)
00354     return -1;
00355   if (a < 0 && b < 0)
00356     {
00357       int af = job->elements[-a - 1] & SOLVER_ESSENTIAL;
00358       int bf = job->elements[-b - 1] & SOLVER_ESSENTIAL;
00359       int x = af - bf;
00360       if (x)
00361         return x;
00362     }
00363   return a - b;
00364 }
00365 
00366 /*
00367  * convert a solution rule into a job modifier
00368  */
00369 static void
00370 convertsolution(Solver *solv, Id why, Queue *solutionq)
00371 {
00372   Pool *pool = solv->pool;
00373   if (why < 0)
00374     {
00375       queue_push(solutionq, 0);
00376       queue_push(solutionq, -why);
00377       return;
00378     }
00379   if (why >= solv->infarchrules && why < solv->infarchrules_end)
00380     {
00381       Id p, name;
00382       /* infarch rule, find replacement */
00383       assert(solv->rules[why].p < 0);
00384       name = pool->solvables[-solv->rules[why].p].name;
00385       while (why > solv->infarchrules && pool->solvables[-solv->rules[why - 1].p].name == name)
00386         why--;
00387       p = 0;
00388       for (; why < solv->infarchrules_end && pool->solvables[-solv->rules[why].p].name == name; why++)
00389         if (solv->decisionmap[-solv->rules[why].p] > 0)
00390           {
00391             p = -solv->rules[why].p;
00392             break;
00393           }
00394       if (!p)
00395         return;         /* false alarm */
00396       queue_push(solutionq, SOLVER_SOLUTION_INFARCH);
00397       queue_push(solutionq, p);
00398       return;
00399     }
00400   if (why >= solv->duprules && why < solv->duprules_end)
00401     {
00402       Id p, name;
00403       /* dist upgrade rule, find replacement */
00404       assert(solv->rules[why].p < 0);
00405       name = pool->solvables[-solv->rules[why].p].name;
00406       while (why > solv->duprules && pool->solvables[-solv->rules[why - 1].p].name == name)
00407         why--;
00408       p = 0;
00409       for (; why < solv->duprules_end && pool->solvables[-solv->rules[why].p].name == name; why++)
00410         if (solv->decisionmap[-solv->rules[why].p] > 0)
00411           {
00412             p = -solv->rules[why].p;
00413             break;
00414           }
00415       if (!p)
00416         return;         /* false alarm */
00417       queue_push(solutionq, SOLVER_SOLUTION_DISTUPGRADE);
00418       queue_push(solutionq, p);
00419       return;
00420     }
00421   if (why >= solv->updaterules && why < solv->updaterules_end)
00422     {
00423       /* update rule, find replacement package */
00424       Id p, *dp, rp = 0;
00425       Rule *rr;
00426 
00427       assert(why >= solv->updaterules && why < solv->updaterules_end);
00428       /* check if this is a false positive, i.e. the update rule is fulfilled */
00429       rr = solv->rules + why;
00430       FOR_RULELITERALS(p, dp, rr)
00431         if (p > 0 && solv->decisionmap[p] > 0)
00432           break;
00433       if (p)
00434         return;         /* false alarm */
00435 
00436       p = solv->installed->start + (why - solv->updaterules);
00437       rr = solv->rules + solv->featurerules + (why - solv->updaterules);
00438       if (!rr->p)
00439         rr = solv->rules + why;
00440       if (solv->dupmap_all && solv->rules[why].p != p && solv->decisionmap[p] > 0)
00441         {
00442           /* distupgrade case, allow to keep old package */
00443           queue_push(solutionq, SOLVER_SOLUTION_DISTUPGRADE);
00444           queue_push(solutionq, p);
00445           return;
00446         }
00447       if (solv->decisionmap[p] > 0)
00448         return;         /* false alarm, turned out we can keep the package */
00449       if (rr->w2)
00450         {
00451           int mvrp = 0;         /* multi-version replacement */
00452           FOR_RULELITERALS(rp, dp, rr)
00453             {
00454               if (rp > 0 && solv->decisionmap[rp] > 0 && pool->solvables[rp].repo != solv->installed)
00455                 {
00456                   mvrp = rp;
00457                   if (!(solv->noobsoletes.size && MAPTST(&solv->noobsoletes, rp)))
00458                     break;
00459                 }
00460             }
00461           if (!rp && mvrp)
00462             {
00463               /* found only multi-version replacements */
00464               /* have to split solution into two parts */
00465               queue_push(solutionq, p);
00466               queue_push(solutionq, mvrp);
00467             }
00468         }
00469       queue_push(solutionq, p);
00470       queue_push(solutionq, rp);
00471       return;
00472     }
00473 }
00474 
00475 /*
00476  * convert problem data into a form usable for refining.
00477  * Returns the number of problems.
00478  */
00479 int
00480 solver_prepare_solutions(Solver *solv)
00481 {
00482   int i, j = 1, idx = 1;  
00483 
00484   if (!solv->problems.count)
00485     return 0;
00486   queue_push(&solv->solutions, 0); 
00487   queue_push(&solv->solutions, -1); /* unrefined */
00488   for (i = 1; i < solv->problems.count; i++) 
00489     {   
00490       Id p = solv->problems.elements[i];
00491       queue_push(&solv->solutions, p); 
00492       if (p) 
00493         continue;
00494       solv->problems.elements[j++] = idx; 
00495       if (i + 1 >= solv->problems.count)
00496         break;
00497       solv->problems.elements[j++] = solv->problems.elements[++i];  /* copy proofidx */
00498       idx = solv->solutions.count;
00499       queue_push(&solv->solutions, -1); 
00500     }   
00501   solv->problems.count = j;  
00502   return j / 2;
00503 }
00504 
00505 /*
00506  * refine the simple solution rule list provided by
00507  * the solver into multiple lists of job modifiers.
00508  */
00509 static void
00510 create_solutions(Solver *solv, int probnr, int solidx)
00511 {
00512   Pool *pool = solv->pool;
00513   Queue redoq;
00514   Queue problem, solution, problems_save;
00515   int i, j, nsol;
00516   int essentialok;
00517   int recocount;
00518   unsigned int now;
00519 
00520   now = sat_timems(0);
00521   recocount = solv->recommendations.count;
00522   solv->recommendations.count = 0;      /* so that revert() doesn't mess with it later */
00523   queue_init(&redoq);
00524   /* save decisionq, decisionq_why, decisionmap */
00525   for (i = 0; i < solv->decisionq.count; i++)
00526     {
00527       Id p = solv->decisionq.elements[i];
00528       queue_push(&redoq, p);
00529       queue_push(&redoq, solv->decisionq_why.elements[i]);
00530       queue_push(&redoq, solv->decisionmap[p > 0 ? p : -p]);
00531     }
00532   /* save problems queue */
00533   problems_save = solv->problems;
00534   memset(&solv->problems, 0, sizeof(solv->problems));
00535 
00536   /* extract problem from queue */
00537   queue_init(&problem);
00538   for (i = solidx + 1; i < solv->solutions.count; i++)
00539     {
00540       Id v = solv->solutions.elements[i];
00541       if (!v)
00542         break;
00543       queue_push(&problem, v);
00544     }
00545   if (problem.count > 1)
00546     sat_sort(problem.elements, problem.count, sizeof(Id), problems_sortcmp, &solv->job);
00547   queue_push(&problem, 0);      /* mark end for refine_suggestion */
00548   problem.count--;
00549 #if 0
00550   for (i = 0; i < problem.count; i++)
00551     printf("PP %d %d\n", i, problem.elements[i]);
00552 #endif
00553 
00554   /* refine each solution element */
00555   nsol = 0;
00556   essentialok = 0;
00557   queue_init(&solution);
00558   for (i = 0; i < problem.count; i++)
00559     {
00560       int solstart = solv->solutions.count;
00561       refine_suggestion(solv, problem.elements, problem.elements[i], &solution, essentialok);
00562       queue_push(&solv->solutions, 0);  /* reserve room for number of elements */
00563       for (j = 0; j < solution.count; j++)
00564         convertsolution(solv, solution.elements[j], &solv->solutions);
00565       if (solv->solutions.count == solstart + 1)
00566         {
00567           solv->solutions.count--;      /* this one did not work out */
00568           if (nsol || i + 1 < problem.count)
00569             continue;                   /* got one or still hope */
00570           if (!essentialok)
00571             {
00572               /* nothing found, start over */
00573               POOL_DEBUG(SAT_DEBUG_SOLUTIONS, "nothing found, re-run with essentialok = 1\n");
00574               essentialok = 1;
00575               i = -1;
00576               continue;
00577             }
00578           /* this is bad, we found no solution */
00579           /* for now just offer a rule */
00580           POOL_DEBUG(SAT_DEBUG_SOLUTIONS, "nothing found, already did essentialok, fake it\n");
00581           queue_push(&solv->solutions, 0);
00582           for (j = 0; j < problem.count; j++)
00583             {
00584               queue_empty(&solution);
00585               queue_push(&solution, problem.elements[j]);
00586               convertsolution(solv, solution.elements[j], &solv->solutions);
00587               if (solv->solutions.count > solstart + 1)
00588                 break;
00589             }
00590           if (solv->solutions.count == solstart + 1)
00591             {
00592               solv->solutions.count--;
00593               continue;         /* sorry */
00594             }
00595         }
00596       /* patch in number of solution elements */
00597       solv->solutions.elements[solstart] = (solv->solutions.count - (solstart + 1)) / 2;
00598       queue_push(&solv->solutions, 0);  /* add end marker */
00599       queue_push(&solv->solutions, 0);  /* add end marker */
00600       solv->solutions.elements[solidx + 1 + nsol++] = solstart;
00601     }
00602   solv->solutions.elements[solidx + 1 + nsol] = 0;      /* end marker */
00603   solv->solutions.elements[solidx] = nsol;
00604   queue_free(&problem);
00605   queue_free(&solution);
00606 
00607   /* restore decisions */
00608   memset(solv->decisionmap, 0, pool->nsolvables * sizeof(Id));
00609   queue_empty(&solv->decisionq);
00610   queue_empty(&solv->decisionq_why);
00611   for (i = 0; i < redoq.count; i += 3)
00612     {
00613       Id p = redoq.elements[i];
00614       queue_push(&solv->decisionq, p);
00615       queue_push(&solv->decisionq_why, redoq.elements[i + 1]);
00616       solv->decisionmap[p > 0 ? p : -p] = redoq.elements[i + 2];
00617     }
00618   solv->recommendations.count = recocount;
00619   queue_free(&redoq);
00620   /* restore problems */
00621   queue_free(&solv->problems);
00622   solv->problems = problems_save;
00623   POOL_DEBUG(SAT_DEBUG_STATS, "create_solutions for problem #%d took %d ms\n", probnr, sat_timems(now));
00624 }
00625 
00626 
00627 /**************************************************************************/
00628 
00629 unsigned int
00630 solver_problem_count(Solver *solv)
00631 {
00632   return solv->problems.count / 2;
00633 }
00634 
00635 Id
00636 solver_next_problem(Solver *solv, Id problem)
00637 {
00638   if (!problem)
00639     return solv->problems.count ? 1 : 0;
00640   return (problem + 1) * 2 - 1 < solv->problems.count ? problem + 1 : 0;
00641 }
00642 
00643 unsigned int
00644 solver_solution_count(Solver *solv, Id problem)
00645 {
00646   Id solidx = solv->problems.elements[problem * 2 - 1];
00647   if (solv->solutions.elements[solidx] < 0)
00648     create_solutions(solv, problem, solidx);
00649   return solv->solutions.elements[solidx];
00650 }
00651 
00652 Id
00653 solver_next_solution(Solver *solv, Id problem, Id solution)
00654 {
00655   Id solidx = solv->problems.elements[problem * 2 - 1];
00656   if (solv->solutions.elements[solidx] < 0)
00657     create_solutions(solv, problem, solidx);
00658   return solv->solutions.elements[solidx + solution + 1] ? solution + 1 : 0;
00659 }
00660 
00661 unsigned int
00662 solver_solutionelement_count(Solver *solv, Id problem, Id solution)
00663 {
00664   Id solidx = solv->problems.elements[problem * 2 - 1];
00665   solidx = solv->solutions.elements[solidx + solution];
00666   return solv->solutions.elements[solidx];
00667 }
00668 
00669 
00670 /*
00671  *  return the next item of the proposed solution
00672  *  here are the possibilities for p / rp and what
00673  *  the solver expects the application to do:
00674  *    p                             rp
00675  *  -------------------------------------------------------
00676  *    SOLVER_SOLUTION_INFARCH       pkgid
00677  *    -> add (SOLVER_INSTALL|SOLVER_SOLVABLE, rp) to the job
00678  *    SOLVER_SOLUTION_DISTUPGRADE   pkgid
00679  *    -> add (SOLVER_INSTALL|SOLVER_SOLVABLE, rp) to the job
00680  *    SOLVER_SOLUTION_JOB           jobidx
00681  *    -> remove job (jobidx - 1, jobidx) from job queue
00682  *    pkgid (> 0)                   0
00683  *    -> add (SOLVER_ERASE|SOLVER_SOLVABLE, p) to the job
00684  *    pkgid (> 0)                   pkgid (> 0)
00685  *    -> add (SOLVER_INSTALL|SOLVER_SOLVABLE, rp) to the job
00686  *       (this will replace package p)
00687  *         
00688  * Thus, the solver will either ask the application to remove
00689  * a specific job from the job queue, or ask to add an install/erase
00690  * job to it.
00691  *
00692  */
00693 
00694 Id
00695 solver_next_solutionelement(Solver *solv, Id problem, Id solution, Id element, Id *p, Id *rp)
00696 {
00697   Id solidx = solv->problems.elements[problem * 2 - 1];
00698   solidx = solv->solutions.elements[solidx + solution];
00699   if (!solidx)
00700     return 0;
00701   solidx += 1 + element * 2;
00702   if (!solv->solutions.elements[solidx] && !solv->solutions.elements[solidx + 1])
00703     return 0;
00704   *p = solv->solutions.elements[solidx];
00705   *rp = solv->solutions.elements[solidx + 1];
00706   return element + 1;
00707 }
00708 
00709 void
00710 solver_take_solutionelement(Solver *solv, Id p, Id rp, Queue *job)
00711 {
00712   int i;
00713 
00714   if (p == SOLVER_SOLUTION_JOB)
00715     {
00716       job->elements[rp - 1] = SOLVER_NOOP;
00717       job->elements[rp] = 0;
00718       return;
00719     }
00720   if (rp <= 0 && p <= 0)
00721     return;     /* just in case */
00722   if (rp > 0)
00723     p = SOLVER_INSTALL|SOLVER_SOLVABLE;
00724   else
00725     {
00726       rp = p;
00727       p = SOLVER_ERASE|SOLVER_SOLVABLE;
00728     }
00729   for (i = 0; i < job->count; i += 2)
00730     if (job->elements[i] == p && job->elements[i + 1] == rp)
00731       return;
00732   queue_push2(job, p, rp);
00733 }
00734 
00735 void
00736 solver_take_solution(Solver *solv, Id problem, Id solution, Queue *job)
00737 {
00738   Id p, rp, element = 0;
00739   while ((element = solver_next_solutionelement(solv, problem, solution, element, &p, &rp)) != 0)
00740     solver_take_solutionelement(solv, p, rp, job);
00741 }
00742 
00743 
00744 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------
00745  * 
00746  * find problem rule
00747  */
00748 
00749 static void
00750 findproblemrule_internal(Solver *solv, Id idx, Id *reqrp, Id *conrp, Id *sysrp, Id *jobrp)
00751 {
00752   Id rid, d;
00753   Id lreqr, lconr, lsysr, ljobr;
00754   Rule *r;
00755   Id jobassert = 0;
00756   int i, reqset = 0;    /* 0: unset, 1: installed, 2: jobassert, 3: assert */
00757 
00758   /* find us a jobassert rule */
00759   for (i = idx; (rid = solv->learnt_pool.elements[i]) != 0; i++)
00760     {
00761       if (rid < solv->jobrules || rid >= solv->jobrules_end)
00762         continue;
00763       r = solv->rules + rid;
00764       d = r->d < 0 ? -r->d - 1 : r->d;
00765       if (!d && r->w2 == 0 && r->p > 0)
00766         {
00767           jobassert = r->p;
00768           break;
00769         }
00770     }
00771 
00772   /* the problem rules are somewhat ordered from "near to the problem" to
00773    * "near to the job" */
00774   lreqr = lconr = lsysr = ljobr = 0;
00775   while ((rid = solv->learnt_pool.elements[idx++]) != 0)
00776     {
00777       assert(rid > 0);
00778       if (rid >= solv->learntrules)
00779         findproblemrule_internal(solv, solv->learnt_why.elements[rid - solv->learntrules], &lreqr, &lconr, &lsysr, &ljobr);
00780       else if ((rid >= solv->jobrules && rid < solv->jobrules_end) || (rid >= solv->infarchrules && rid < solv->infarchrules_end) || (rid >= solv->duprules && rid < solv->duprules_end))
00781         {
00782           if (!*jobrp)
00783             *jobrp = rid;
00784         }
00785       else if (rid >= solv->updaterules && rid < solv->updaterules_end)
00786         {
00787           if (!*sysrp)
00788             *sysrp = rid;
00789         }
00790       else
00791         {
00792           assert(rid < solv->rpmrules_end);
00793           r = solv->rules + rid;
00794           d = r->d < 0 ? -r->d - 1 : r->d;
00795           if (!d && r->w2 < 0)
00796             {
00797               if (!*conrp)
00798                 *conrp = rid;
00799             }
00800           else
00801             {
00802               if (!d && r->w2 == 0 && reqset < 3)
00803                 {
00804                   if (*reqrp > 0 && r->p < -1)
00805                     {
00806                       Id op = -solv->rules[*reqrp].p;
00807                       if (op > 1 && solv->pool->solvables[op].arch != solv->pool->solvables[-r->p].arch)
00808                         continue;       /* different arch, skip */
00809                     }
00810                   /* prefer assertions */
00811                   *reqrp = rid;
00812                   reqset = 3;
00813                 }
00814               else if (jobassert && r->p == -jobassert)
00815                 {
00816                   /* prefer rules of job assertions */
00817                   *reqrp = rid;
00818                   reqset = 2;
00819                 }
00820               else if (solv->installed && r->p < 0 && solv->pool->solvables[-r->p].repo == solv->installed && reqset <= 1)
00821                 {
00822                   /* prefer rules of job installed package so that the user doesn't get confused by strange packages */
00823                   *reqrp = rid;
00824                   reqset = 1;
00825                 }
00826               else if (!*reqrp)
00827                 *reqrp = rid;
00828             }
00829         }
00830     }
00831   if (!*reqrp && lreqr)
00832     *reqrp = lreqr;
00833   if (!*conrp && lconr)
00834     *conrp = lconr;
00835   if (!*jobrp && ljobr)
00836     *jobrp = ljobr;
00837   if (!*sysrp && lsysr)
00838     *sysrp = lsysr;
00839 }
00840 
00841 /* 
00842  * find problem rule
00843  *
00844  * search for a rule that describes the problem to the
00845  * user. Actually a pretty hopeless task that may leave the user
00846  * puzzled. To get all of the needed information use
00847  * solver_findallproblemrules() instead.
00848  */
00849 
00850 Id
00851 solver_findproblemrule(Solver *solv, Id problem)
00852 {
00853   Id reqr, conr, sysr, jobr;
00854   Id idx = solv->problems.elements[2 * problem - 2];
00855   reqr = conr = sysr = jobr = 0;
00856   findproblemrule_internal(solv, idx, &reqr, &conr, &sysr, &jobr);
00857   if (reqr)
00858     return reqr;        /* some requires */
00859   if (conr)
00860     return conr;        /* some conflict */
00861   if (sysr)
00862     return sysr;        /* an update rule */
00863   if (jobr)
00864     return jobr;        /* a user request */
00865   assert(0);
00866 }
00867 
00868 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00869 
00870 static void
00871 findallproblemrules_internal(Solver *solv, Id idx, Queue *rules)
00872 {
00873   Id rid;
00874   while ((rid = solv->learnt_pool.elements[idx++]) != 0)
00875     {
00876       if (rid >= solv->learntrules)
00877         {
00878           findallproblemrules_internal(solv, solv->learnt_why.elements[rid - solv->learntrules], rules);
00879           continue;
00880         }
00881       queue_pushunique(rules, rid);
00882     }
00883 }
00884 
00885 /*
00886  * find all problem rule
00887  *
00888  * return all rules that lead to the problem. This gives the user
00889  * all of the information to understand the problem, but the result
00890  * can be a large number of rules.
00891  */
00892 
00893 void
00894 solver_findallproblemrules(Solver *solv, Id problem, Queue *rules)
00895 {
00896   queue_empty(rules);
00897   findallproblemrules_internal(solv, solv->problems.elements[2 * problem - 2], rules);
00898 }
00899 
00900 /* obsolete function */
00901 SolverRuleinfo
00902 solver_problemruleinfo(Solver *solv, Queue *job, Id rid, Id *depp, Id *sourcep, Id *targetp)
00903 {
00904   return solver_ruleinfo(solv, rid, sourcep, targetp, depp);
00905 }
